intro: Carduncellus araneosus var. nanus, commonly known as the dwarf spider-thistle, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with a distinctive, spiny texture. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, with narrow, gray-green leaves that have a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late summer to early autumn. This variety is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
